layerItems.description:
OpenEmbedded-Core is a layer containing the core metadata for current versions
of OpenEmbedded. It is distro-less (can build a functional image with
DISTRO = "nodistro") and contains only emulated machine support.
layerItems.name: openembedded-core

layerItems.description:
This layer provides security tools, hardening tools for Linux kernels
and libraries for implementing security mechanisms.
layerItems.name: meta-security

recipes.description: This is a small simple module which simplifies the manipulation of @INC at compile time. It is typically used to add extra directories to Perl's search path so that later 'use' or 'require' statements will find modules which are not located in the default search path.

recipes.description: Buck-Security is a security scanner for Debian and Ubuntu Linux. It runs a couple of important checks and helps you to harden your Linux system. This enables you to quickly overview the security status of your Linux system.
The checksec script is designed to test what standard Linux OS and PaX security features are being used.
Smack scripts

recipes.description: user-space parser utility for AppArmor  This provides the system initialization scripts needed to use the  AppArmor Mandatory Access Control system, including the AppArmor Parser  which is required to convert AppArmor text profiles into machine-readable  policies that are loaded into the kernel for use with the AppArmor Linux  Security Module.
recipes.inherits: autotools autotools-brokensep bash-completion cpan cpan-base features_check perl-version perlnative pkgconfig python3-dir python3native python3targetconfig python_pep517 setuptools3 setuptools3-base siteconfig siteinfo systemd update-rc.d

recipes.description:
TOMOYO Linux is a Mandatory Access Control (MAC) implementation for Linux that can be used to increase the security of a system, while also being useful purely as a system analysis tool. 
To start via command line add: 
security=tomoyo TOMOYO_trigger=/usr/lib/systemd/systemd 
To initialize: 
/usr/lib/ccs/init_policy
recipes.inherits: features_check

recipes.description: Firejail is a SUID sandbox program that reduces the risk of security breaches by restricting the running environment of untrusted applications using Linux namespaces, seccomp-bpf and Linux capabilities.
recipes.inherits: autotools autotools-brokensep bash-completion features_check pkgconfig siteconfig siteinfo

recipes.description: CHIPSEC is a framework for analyzing the security                of PC platforms including hardware, system firmware                (BIOS/UEFI), and platform components.
recipes.inherits: kernel-arch kernel-module-split module module-base pkgconfig python3-dir python3native python3targetconfig python_pep517 setuptools3 setuptools3-base

recipes.description: Aircrack-ng is an 802.11 WEP and WPA-PSK keys cracking program that can recover keys once enough data packets have been captured. It implements the standard FMS attack along with some optimizations like KoreK attacks, as well as the PTW attack, thus making the attack much faster compared to other WEP cracking tools.
recipes.inherits: autotools autotools-brokensep pkgconfig siteconfig siteinfo
recipes.summary: Aircrack-ng is a set of tools for auditing wireless networks

recipes.description: checksecurity is a simple package which will scan your system for several simple security holes.
Bastille Linux is a Hardening and Reporting/Auditing Program which enhances the security of a Linux box, by configuring daemons, system settings and firewalling.
Nikto is an Open Source web server scanner which performs comprehensive tests against web servers
SSSD is a system security services daemon

recipes.description: privacyIDEA is an open solution for strong two-factor authentication like OTP tokens, SMS, smartphones or SSH keys. Using privacyIDEA you can enhance your existing applications like local login (PAM, Windows Credential Provider), VPN, remote access, SSH connections, access to web sites or web portals with a second factor during authentication. Thus boosting the security of your existing applications.
recipes.inherits: pypi python3-dir python3native python3targetconfig python_pep517 setuptools3 setuptools3-base
pypi python3-dir python3native python3targetconfig python_pep517 setuptools3 setuptools3-base
recipes.summary: Add version info to file paths.

recipes.description: Fail2Ban scans log files like /var/log/auth.log and bans IP addresses having too many failed login attempts. It does this by updating system firewall rules to reject new connections from those IP addresses, for a configurable amount of time. Fail2Ban comes out-of-the-box ready to read many standard log files, such as those for sshd and Apache, and is easy to configure to read any log file you choose, for any error you choose.
recipes.inherits: ptest python3-dir python3native python3targetconfig setuptools3-base setuptools3_legacy update-rc.d
recipes.summary: Daemon to ban hosts that cause multiple authentication errors.
